channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As talks move forward, Trump's Gaza plan sparks both hope and uncertainty
item.description: Israelis and Palestinians share cautious reactions to President Trump's plan to end the war, as talks move forward and airstrikes continue.
item.content:encoded: Israelis and Palestinians share cautious reactions to President Trump's plan to end the war, as talks move forward and airstrikes continue.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: What's driving President Trump's new confidence in Ukraine's war effort
item.description: The president's bold statement surprised allies and raised new questions about whether U.S. policy toward the war is changing.
item.content:encoded: The president's bold statement surprised allies and raised new questions about whether U.S. policy toward the war is changing.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordo√±ez

item.title: A TV show aims to inspire Gen Alpha and beyond to carry on Jane Goodall's legacy
item.description: J.J. Johnson, creator of the television series Jane, reflects on working with Jane Goodall and inspiring young viewers to care for the planet.
item.content:encoded: J.J. Johnson, creator of the television series Jane, reflects on working with Jane Goodall and inspiring young viewers to care for the planet.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: The image Saudi Arabia hopes to achieve beyond the comedy festival
item.description: Saudi Arabia is working to reshape its global cultural image, but controversies over several acts in its comedy festival tied to the country's human rights record are underscoring the tension between the government's Vision 2030 ambitions and how the kingdom is perceived abroad.
item.content:encoded: Saudi Arabia is working to reshape its global cultural image, but controversies over several acts in its comedy festival tied to the country's human rights record are underscoring the tension between the government's Vision 2030 ambitions and how the kingdom is perceived abroad.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Visitors turned away from the California redwoods as the government shuts down
item.description: Thousands of travelers arrive at Muir Woods to find locked gates and few answers as the shutdown ripples through America's national parks.
item.content:encoded: Thousands of travelers arrive at Muir Woods to find locked gates and few answers as the shutdown ripples through America's national parks.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Wright

item.title: In Ireland, one small town is still playing matchmaker
item.description: For more than 150 years, Lisdoonvarna's festival has helped people find connection the old-fashioned way.
item.content:encoded: For more than 150 years, Lisdoonvarna's festival has helped people find connection the old-fashioned way.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: The Texas podcast exploring the culture behind every taco
item.description: Mando Rayo reports on taco culture across Texas. In his podcast with member station KUT, he tells the stories of the people behind the food and how tacos reflect history, identity, and political divides.
item.content:encoded: Mando Rayo reports on taco culture across Texas. In his podcast with member station KUT, he tells the stories of the people behind the food and how tacos reflect history, identity, and political divides.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Little sign of peace after Trump Congo deal
item.description: Peace in eastern Congo remains elusive, despite a U.S.-brokered deal that President Trump calls historic.
item.content:encoded: Peace in eastern Congo remains elusive, despite a U.S.-brokered deal that President Trump calls historic.
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: What the H1B visa application fee hike could mean for the U.S. economy
item.description: An economist explains the impact the H-1B visa program has had on the U.S. economy and native-born workers. And what the new hundred thousand dollar fee could mean for the future of the program.
item.content:encoded: An economist explains the impact the H-1B visa program has had on the U.S. economy and native-born workers. And what the new hundred thousand dollar fee could mean for the future of the program.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Protests grow in Italy against Israel's offensive in Gaza
item.description: Protests calling for an end to Israel's offensive against Hamas brought hundreds thousands of people onto the streets in Italy, according to the labor union which helped organize them.
item.content:encoded: Protests calling for an end to Israel's offensive against Hamas brought hundreds thousands of people onto the streets in Italy, according to the labor union which helped organize them.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock
